results.title: ADMA for short
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide Pictures, British Petroleum and Ronnie Anscombe
results.brief_description: The building of ADMA enterprise, a special oil drilling platform developed for underwater oil exploration. Exploring for oil on the bed of the Persian Gulf involved the development of this floating platform in a shipyard on Kiel Canal, and the transformation of Das Island, an uninhabited outcrop of rock in the Persian Gulf, into an outpost of industrial civilisation, complete with harbour, airstrip, living quarters and workshops.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Carr, World Wide Pictures, British Petroleum and Ronnie Anscombe

results.title: Adjusting pressure actuated temperature control devices
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and Anson Bond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Explains the purpose of pressure actuated temperature control devices; how to adjust the pressure actuated motor control and how to adjust the metering type and snap-action two-temperature valves.

results.title: Adjusting and repairing the thermo expansion valve
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and Anson Bond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Explains the theory of multiple commercial refrigeration systems, how to test and adjust the thermo-expansion valve, recognize symptoms of trouble with the valve and repair it.

results.title: Adenauer: Germany reborn
results.creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns, New York Times Productions and Don Thompson
results.brief_description: A presentation of the career of Adenauer, West Germany’s Chancellor from 1945-1963. Provides footage of the concentration camps, the Nuremburg trial, the Allied occupation of Germany, the Berlin airlift of 1948, the establishment of a new government in Bonn in 1949 and the building of the Berlin wall. Pro American narration by Henry Fonda.

results.title: Adelheid [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Filmove Studio Barrandov and Frantisek Vlacil
results.brief_description: A work of the Czech New Wave film movement which emerged during the 1960s only to be brutally repressed after the Soviet invasion of Czechoslovakia in 1968, “Adelheid” is a gripping love story confronting the human dimensions of love and loyalty, and of individuals trapped in the march of history. Viktor has returned to Czechoslovakia after serving as an opposition soldier in Britain during World War II. He has been assigned to manage a confiscated German mansion in northern Moravia, along the Czech and German border, a location that allows the film to ruminate on recent history and ethnic strife. He soon falls in love with Adelheid, daughter of the former owner of the house who has been reduced to servant status. Despite the fact that she can’t speak a word of Czech and he can’t speak German, the pair develop a mute, uneasy romantic and sexual understanding. Beyond Viktor’s enamored power play and Adelheid’s inscrutable complacence, their affair is fleshed out by their mutual loneliness and shared loss. Cast includes Petr Cepek, Emma Cerna, Jan Vostrcil and Pavel Landovsky. In Czech with English subtitles.

results.title: Adelaide: Vintage City
results.brief_description: A panoramic view of the pleasures awaiting visitors to Adelaide, a city set among vineyards, garden suburbs, the sea and the Loft Mountain Ranges. Includes sporting events and the attractive parks, restaurants and lakes.

results.title: Adelaide: flowers and festival
results.creator_credit: South Australian Government Tourist Bureau, G Shepherd and J.A. Correll
results.brief_description: Scenes in Adelaide showing events in the biennial Festival of Arts 1968. The accent is on Flower Day and its associated pageantry and processions. Snippets of the Festival of Arts demonstrate Adelaide’s attractiveness as a festival venue during vintage time when the weather is still sunny. Narrated by Peter Wells.
